text.text: This is a alpha / tech demo for the Theurgy Mod. What you're using right now is the custom guidebook system. Right now you're in a "page". Do you see where the page is crumpled at the bottom? Try clicking it!

That's the "Next Page" button! Now there should be a previous page one. Don't click it yet but continue reading... 
 This is a double page. It's like a page, but double!
You might be wondering. Am I stuck here? Fortunately, you aren't! You can r-click to close this page! But before you do that, there's one last page after this one...
That being the last page. What a shocker amirite. Every entry can be completed, and this will give access to those that depend on it. Some entries might need some requirements before being completed

Now you might be wondering, why tech demo? Why not alpha? 
 The reason is simple. I am not satisfied yet with the amount of content in this version to call it a proper alpha. 
 This is more of a showcase of something I've been working on

extra.text:
The use of magical forces to manifest a change in the world. 
This book, written by none other than the first researcher of Theurgy [me], will accompany you through your journey to become a competent Theurgist

text.text: In this world there's a force present, called

extra.text:
, although they are commonly referred to as "mions". 
These mions are everywhere, but in some parts of the world they tend to gather more. These places are what we call "Magical Forest"

text.text:
But don't be fooled, as the mions don't settle just in the surface. 
Sometimes underground you might find crystals encased in stone, formed of mions crystallized by the underground pressure.
These crystals seem to randomly attune to one of the 6 elemental

extra.text: They are the "physical" form of the 4 common elements:

You might say: 
"4? Didn't you say 6?"

text.text: That's right, they are 6. The last 2 are not something we commonly call elements, but are present throughout the entire world:

Like previously mentioned, while exploring the underground region of a magical forest you might encounter aspectus ores.
 During my researches I was not able to find a relation between where the crystallization happened, and what type of aspectus was created, but I did figure something out...

... That being that Magical Forests themselves are found nearer cold places, and are quite rare near hot places. Having a second page was totally for suspense, not because I didn't have enough space. Absolutely.

After continuing my research on Aspectus Ores, I was actually able to figure out some things.
The ores themselves are quite fragile, and nothing is able to harvest them directly, not even the softest of touch. Breaking them will only yield aspectus crystals, that while useful aren't as good as the ore itself.

You might be wondering why. That's where the second discovery comes. While breaking the ores will yield crystals, if left alone they will, albeit slowly, produce geodes. 
These geodes will yield less crystals when broken, but an ore can produce seemingly infinite amount of geodes.
These geodes seem to be more resistant than the ores, and can be obtained when being careful [Silk Touch]

After starting your research, you might have realized that the crafting table you're used to doesn't really cut it. Worry not, as there's a solution! 
Introducing the Theurgist's Bench
This new table can handle all the recipes your old table can, but also some more...
It can hold your items, and can both interact with crystallized and ambient mion!
